sections.heading: Two Number Systems
sections.content:
Japanese uses two distinct number systems with different origins and uses:

| System | Origin | Japanese Term | Range | Usage | | ------ | -------- | ------------- | ----------- | -------------------------- | | Native | Japanese | 和語 (わご) | 1-10 | General items, traditional | | Sino | Chinese | 漢語 (かんご) | All numbers | Most counting, modern use |

Native: ひとつ、ふたつ、みっつ Sino: いち、に、さん

sections.heading: Complete Comparison (1-10)
sections.content: | # | Native Reading | Kanji | Sino Reading | Kanji | | --- | -------------------- | ----- | ----------------------- | ----- | | 1 | ひとつ (hitotsu) | 一つ | いち (ichi) | 一 | | 2 | ふたつ (futatsu) | 二つ | に (ni) | 二 | | 3 | みっつ (mittsu) | 三つ | さん (san) | 三 | | 4 | よっつ (yottsu) | 四つ | よん/し (yon/shi) | 四 | | 5 | いつつ (itsutsu) | 五つ | ご (go) | 五 | | 6 | むっつ (muttsu) | 六つ | ろく (roku) | 六 | | 7 | ななつ (nanatsu) | 七つ | なな/しち (nana/shichi) | 七 | | 8 | やっつ (yattsu) | 八つ | はち (hachi) | 八 | | 9 | ここのつ (kokonotsu) | 九つ | きゅう/く (kyuu/ku) | 九 | | 10 | とお (too) | 十 | じゅう (juu) | 十 |

children.heading: Key Observations
children.content: Native numbers end in つ (tsu) for 1-9 Native number 10 is とお (too), not とおつ Native numbers are rarely used above 10 Sino numbers continue infinitely

children.heading: 1. With General Counter つ
children.content:
When counting general items without specific counters:

りんごを3つ買いました "I bought 3 apples" 質問が2つあります "I have 2 questions" 問題は4つです "There are 4 problems"

children.heading: 2. Young Children's Age
children.content:
Informally, for children under 10:

A: いくつ？ "How old?" B: 5つ "Five (years old)"

More formally: 5 歳 (ごさい)

children.heading: 3. Time Expressions
children.content:
For counting hours (but NOT telling time):

2時間 = ふたつ分 (informal) But saying the time: 2時 (にじ) - uses Sino

children.heading: 4. Traditional or Poetic Contexts
children.content: 一つ二つと星が見える "One by one, stars appear" 七つの海 "The seven seas"

children.heading: 5. Set Phrases and Idioms
children.content: 一つよろしく "Please take care of it" 二つ返事 "Immediate reply" 三つ子の魂百まで "The soul of a three-year-old lasts until 100" (proverb)

children.heading: 1. With Specific Counters
children.content:
All specific counters use Sino numbers:

3人 (さんにん) - 3 people 2本 (にほん) - 2 long objects 5枚 (ごまい) - 5 flat objects 4匹 (よんひき) - 4 small animals

children.heading: 2. Money
children.content: 100円 (ひゃくえん) - 100 yen 1,000円 (せんえん) - 1,000 yen 50円 (ごじゅうえん) - 50 yen

children.heading: 3. Time (Clock Time)
children.content: 3時 (さんじ) - 3 o'clock 5分 (ごふん) - 5 minutes 2時間 (にじかん) - 2 hours

children.heading: 4. Dates and Calendar
children.content:
1月 (いちがつ) - January 5日 (いつか) - 5th day 2025年 (にせんにじゅうごねん) - 2025

Exception: Days 1-10 have special readings, but they're still based on Sino system.

children.heading: 5. Mathematical Operations
children.content: 1 + 2 = 3 いち たす に は さん 5 - 3 = 2 ご ひく さん は に

children.heading: 6. Phone Numbers and Addresses
children.content: 電話: 090-1234-5678 ゼロきゅうゼロ の いちにさんよん の ごろくななはち 住所: 東京都渋谷区1-2-3 とうきょうと しぶやく いちのにのさん

children.heading: 7. Age (Formal)
children.content:
25歳 (にじゅうごさい) - 25 years old 30歳 (さんじゅっさい) - 30 years old

Exception: 20 歳 is はたち (special word)

children.heading: 8. Numbers Above 10
children.content:
Always use Sino numbers:

15 = じゅうご (not じゅうごつ) 20 = にじゅう 100 = ひゃく 1,000 = せん

children.heading: Native Numbers Pattern
children.content:
Stem + つ for 1-9:

ひと + つ = ひとつ (1) ふた + つ = ふたつ (2) み + つ = みっつ (3) よ/よっ + つ = よっつ (4) いつ + つ = いつつ (5) む + つ = むっつ (6) なな + つ = ななつ (7) や + つ = やっつ (8) ここの + つ = ここのつ (9) とお (10) - no つ!

children.heading: Sino Numbers with Counters
children.content:
Number + Counter:

1 + 人 = ひとり (exception!) 2 + 人 = ふたり (exception!) 3 + 人 = さんにん 4 + 本 = よんほん 5 + 枚 = ごまい

children.heading: Origin of Native Numbers
children.content: Ancient Japanese words Existed before Chinese influence Limited to basic counting Still used in daily conversation

children.heading: Origin of Sino Numbers
children.content: Imported from China around 5th-6th century Came with Chinese writing system More systematic and expandable Became standard for most counting

children.heading: Numbers with Two Systems
children.content:
Some numbers can use either system depending on context:

Age (informal): 5つ (いつつ) Age (formal): 5歳 (ごさい) General items: 3つ (みっつ) With counter: 3個 (さんこ)

children.heading: 20 Years Old: はたち
children.content:
A special native word:

20歳 = はたち Not: にじゅっさい ❌ (though sometimes used)

children.heading: Days of the Month (1-10)
children.content:
Special readings mixing both systems:

1日 = ついたち (native origin) 2日 = ふつか (native) 3日 = みっか (native) 4日 = よっか (native) 5日 = いつか (native) 6日 = むいか (native) 7日 = なのか (native) 8日 = ようか (native) 9日 = ここのか (native) 10日 = とおか (native)

But 11 日 onwards use Sino: 11 日 (じゅういちにち)

sections.heading: Mixing Systems (Generally Avoided)
sections.content:
Don't mix systems in the same phrase:

Wrong: ふたつ人 ❌ Right: ふたり or 2人 ✓ "Two people" Wrong: さんつ ❌ Right: みっつ or 3つ ✓ "Three (things)"

children.heading: Example 1: Shopping
children.content: A: りんごをいくつ買いますか？ "How many apples will you buy?" B: 3つください "Three, please" A: 全部で300円です "That's 300 yen in total" (uses Sino for money)

children.heading: Example 2: Age
children.content: A: お子さんはいくつですか？ "How old is your child?" B: 4つです "Four (years old)" (casual) Or: 4歳です "Four years old" (more formal)

children.heading: Example 3: Counting Objects
children.content: A: ペンは何本ありますか？ "How many pens are there?" (uses Sino with counter) B: 5本あります "There are 5"

children.heading: For Native Numbers
children.content:
Think of them as "traditional Japanese counting":

Used for general, everyday items Limited range (1-10) Ends in つ sound (except 10) More casual, conversational feel

children.heading: For Sino Numbers
children.content:
Think of them as "formal, systematic counting":

Used with specific counters Unlimited range More analytical, precise Standard for modern contexts

children.heading: Sino Numbers + Counters Often Change
children.content: 1 + 人 = ひとり (not いちにん) 3 + 本 = さんぼん (not さんほん) 6 + 匹 = ろっぴき (not ろくひき) 8 + 枚 = はちまい (sound lengthens)

children.heading: Native Numbers Don't Use Counters
children.content:
Native numbers use つ, which is already a counter:

3つ ✓ (complete) Not: 3つ個 ❌ (redundant)

children.heading: Use Native Numbers
children.content: いくつありますか？ "How many are there?" → 5つあります 子供が何人いますか？(age) "How many children do you have?" → 3つと5つです (informal age)

children.heading: Use Sino Numbers
children.content: 何人いますか？(people count) "How many people are there?" → 5人います (ごにん) いくらですか？ "How much is it?" → 500円です (ごひゃくえん) 何時ですか？ "What time is it?" → 3時です (さんじ)

sections.heading: Summary Table
sections.content: | Context | System | Example | | -------------------- | ------ | --------------------- | | General items | Native | 3 つ (mittsu) | | With counters | Sino | 3 人 (san-nin) | | Money | Sino | 300 円 (san-byaku en) | | Time | Sino | 3 時 (san-ji) | | Child's age (casual) | Native | 3 つ (mittsu) | | Age (formal) | Sino | 3 歳 (san-sai) | | Dates | Sino | 3 月 (san-gatsu) | | Phone numbers | Sino | 3 (san) | | Above 10 | Sino | 15 (juu-go) |

children.heading: Mistake 1: Using native numbers with counters
children.content: Wrong: みっつ人 ❌ Right: 3人 (さんにん) ✓ "Three people"

children.heading: Mistake 2: Using sino numbers without counters for things
children.content: Unnatural: さん ⚠️ (when counting items) Better: 3つ (みっつ) ✓ "Three (things)"

children.heading: Mistake 3: Native numbers above 10
children.content: Wrong: じゅうつ ❌ Right: じゅう or 10個 ✓ "Ten"

children.heading: Mistake 4: Wrong age expression
children.content: Too casual (adult): 25つです ❌ Correct: 25歳です (にじゅうごさい) ✓ "I'm 25 years old"

sections.heading: Related Grammar Points
sections.content: Number System Overview - Complete number guide Counter System Basics - How counters work General Counter (つ) - Native counting いくつ (ikutsu) - How many/old Specific Counters - 人、本、枚、etc. Age expressions - Talking about age Time expressions - Telling time Date expressions - Calendar dates
